snippet: The temporary program announced by the police commissioner, William J. Bratton, will last 90 days and draw on as many as 400 uniformed officers and detectives in office jobs.
abstract: Temporary program known as Summer All Out is putting as many as 400 New York City officers assigned to desk jobs back on city streets as part of push by Commissioner William J Bratton to head off seasonal spike in crime; 90-day program will draw on uniformed officers and detectives in office assignments such as counterterrorism and personnel work.
lead_paragraph: The temporary program announced by the police commissioner, William J. Bratton, will last 90 days and draw on as many as 400 uniformed officers and detectives in office jobs.

headline.main: Bratton Putting Desk Officers on Streets to Fight New York’s Summer Crime
headline.print_headline: Bratton Putting Desk Officers on Streets to Thwart Crime This Summer
